sv.purpose: Att med reducerat behov av synovialvätskeprover identifiera patienter med gikt.
sv.use:
Använd för att utvärdera mono- eller oligoartrit av oklar etiologi, eller när gikt är en differentialdiagnos.

Kan användas även när analys av synovialvätska ej är möjlig.

Instrumentet utgörs av tre steg med kriterier som ska uppfyllas; de två första stegen genererar en klassifikation alternativt följs upp med vidare frågor för att klargöra klassifikationen.

Steg 1:

≥1 episod av svullnad, smärta eller ömhet i perifer led/bursa 

Steg 2:

Påvisning av uratkristaller i aktuell led, bursa eller hud (tofus/tofi)

Steg 3: klassifikationskriterier genereras via poängsättning av åtta sektioner resulterandes i poängsumma mellan -6 och 23. Gikt klassificeras genom en erhållen poäng om minst ≥8p.
sv.misuse: I oklara fall kan vidare utredning vara indicerad - använd alltid kliniskt omdöme vid bruk av verktyget.

en.purpose: This tool helps to differentiate between those patients with and those without Gout while reducing the need to assess synovial fluid through testing, especially if this is unavailable.
en.use:
Use with patients with mono or oligoarthritis of unclear etiology or when gout is part of the differential diagnosis.

Can be used when synovial fluid testing is not available.

There are  3 levels or steps of criteria to get passed with the first 2 steps unscored but which lead to a definite classification or to allow further questioning to define classification further:

 Step 1 – Entry criterion:

≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa

Step 2 – Sufficient criterion:

Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus

Step 3: Classification criteria (scored) with a range of 0 to 23 with 8 sections with various scores.

A threshold score of ≥8 classifies an individual as having gout.
en.misuse: Supplementary evidence may be needed in cases that are unclear and so always defer to sound clinical judgment when using this tool

other_details.references:
Ref. 1: Neogi T, et al. 2015 Gout Classification Criteria: An American College of Rheumatology/European League Against Rheumatism Collaborative Initiative. Arthritis & Rheumatology. 20015; 67: 2557–2568. doi: 10.1002/art.39254

Ref. 2: Use of online calculator as referenced from the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) and European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) web sites. Accessed at: http://goutclassificationcalculator.auckland.ac.nz

when: $gt0003|≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa|!=null
then: $gt0014|≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa|=$gt0003|≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa|

when: $gt0004|Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus|!=null
then: $gt0015|Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus|=$gt0004|Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus|

when: $gt0003|≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa|!=null
$gt0004|Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus|!=null
$gt0007|How many typical episodes with the following time-course?|!=null
$gt0010|Synovial fluid analysis of a symptomatic (ever) joint or bursa|!=null
$gt0011|Imaging evidence of urate deposition in symptomatic joint/bursa|!=null

(($gt0024|Total score for Step 3|<8)&&(($gt0014|≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa|==1|local::at0018|Yes|)&&($gt0015|Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus|==0|local::at0019|No|)))||(($gt0014|≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa|==0|local::at0017|No|)&&(($gt0015|Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus|==0|local::at0019|No|)&&(($gt0024|Total score for Step 3|==null)||($gt0024|Total score for Step 3|!=null))))
then: $gt0046|Diagnosis of Gout?|=0|local::at0003|No - This patient does NOT meet criteria for gout classification (scores < 8).|

when: (($gt0024|Total score for Step 3|>=8)&&($gt0014|≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa|==1|local::at0018|Yes|))||($gt0015|Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus|==1|local::at0020|Yes|)
then: $gt0046|Diagnosis of Gout?|=1|local::at0004|Yes - This patient MEETS sufficient criterion and can be classified as having gout and/or has a score ≥8|

gt0003.text: ≥1 episod av svullnad, smärta eller ömhet i perifer led/bursa

gt0004.text: Påvisning av uratkristaller i aktuell led, bursa eller hud (tofus/tofi)

gt0005.description: Pattern of joint/bursa involvement during episodes

gt0006.description: Erythema overlying joint (reported or observed); can't bear touch or pressure to joint; great difficulty with walking or inability to use joint.

gt0007.text: Hur många episoder med typiskt förlopp?
gt0007.description: ≥2 time course symptoms, regardless of anti-inflammatory use: (1)Time to maximal pain < 24 hours; (2)Resolution of symptoms in ≤14 days; (3)Complete resolution (to baseline level) between symptomatic episodes.

gt0008.description: Draining or chalk-like subcutaneous nodule, located in typical locations: joints, ears, olecranon bursae, finger pads, tendons (e.g., Achilles).

gt0009.description: (Measured by uricase method.) Ideally scored when patient not taking urate-lowering treatment and patient was >4 weeks from an episode. If practical, retest under those conditions. Highest value irrespective of timing should be used.

gt0010.description: Should be assessed by a trained observer.

gt0011.text: Bilddiagnostiskt påvisande av uratdepositioner i symtomatisk led/bursa
gt0011.description: Ultrasound: double-contour sign OR DECT: Demonstrates urate deposition.

gt0012.description: X-Ray of hands or feet with ≥1 erosion.

gt0015.text: Påvisning av uratkristaller i aktuell led, bursa eller hud (tofus/tofi)

gt0020.description: (Measured by uricase method.) Ideally scored when patient not taking urate-lowering treatment and patient was >4 weeks from an episode. If practical, retest under those conditions. Highest value irrespective of timing should be used.

gt0021.description: Should be assessed by a trained observer.

gt0022.text: Bilddiagnostiskt påvisande av uratdepositioner i symtomatisk led/bursa
gt0022.description: Ultrasound: double-contour sign OR DECT: Demonstrates urate deposition.

gt0023.description: X-Ray of hands or feet with ≥1 erosion.

gt0024.description: Total score for the 8 elements of Step 3. Range -6 to 23

gt0027.text: CDS Mönster av ledengagemang under episoder

gt0028.text: CDS Antal föreliggande karakteristika under episoder

gt0029.text: CDS Hur många episoder med typiskt förlopp?

gt0034.text: CDS Bilddiagnostiskt påvisande av giktrelaterad ledskada

gt0046.description: A diagnosis of gout can be made if the Sufficient criteria has been fulfilled or entry and classification criteria are fulfilled with a threshold score of ≥8 classifying an individual as having gout.

gt0001.description: The ACR EULAR Gout Classification Criteria provides a formal diagnostic criteria for gout.

gt0003.text: ≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa

gt0004.text: Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus

gt0005.text: Pattern of joint/bursa involvement during episodes
gt0005.description: Pattern of joint/bursa involvement during episodes

gt0006.description: Erythema overlying joint (reported or observed); can't bear touch or pressure to joint; great difficulty with walking or inability to use joint.

gt0007.text: How many typical episodes with the following time-course?
gt0007.description: ≥2 time course symptoms, regardless of anti-inflammatory use: (1)Time to maximal pain < 24 hours; (2)Resolution of symptoms in ≤14 days; (3)Complete resolution (to baseline level) between symptomatic episodes.

gt0008.description: Draining or chalk-like subcutaneous nodule, located in typical locations: joints, ears, olecranon bursae, finger pads, tendons (e.g., Achilles).

gt0009.description: (Measured by uricase method.) Ideally scored when patient not taking urate-lowering treatment and patient was >4 weeks from an episode. If practical, retest under those conditions. Highest value irrespective of timing should be used.

gt0010.text: Synovial fluid analysis of a symptomatic (ever) joint or bursa
gt0010.description: Should be assessed by a trained observer.

gt0011.text: Imaging evidence of urate deposition in symptomatic joint/bursa
gt0011.description: Ultrasound: double-contour sign OR DECT: Demonstrates urate deposition.

gt0012.text: Imaging evidence of gout-related joint damage
gt0012.description: X-Ray of hands or feet with ≥1 erosion.
